techmeme.title: Canada authorizes the implementation of a 3% levy on revenue from large tech companies that provide digital services to or sell data of Canadian users (Paul Vieira/Wall Street Journal)
Ericsson expects a $1.1B noncash impairment charge in Q2 for its 2022 purchase of cloud communications company Vonage, after a $2.9B impairment charge in 2023 (Sabela Ojea/Wall Street Journal)
Microsoft agrees to pay $14.4M to settle with the California Civil Rights Department over allegations it discriminated against workers who took protected leave (Associated Press)
A federal court in Texas temporarily blocks the US government's ban on noncompete agreements that was set to take effect September 4 (Andrea Hsu/NPR)
Noplace, a Gen Z-focused social media app backed by Alexis Ohanian's 776 and others, tops the US iOS App Store; it raised a $15M Series A1 at a $75M valuation (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
